headline: Retailers, Ducking Trade-War Curveballs, Stick to Their Plans
summary: Then a federal appeals court on Thursday decided that Trump could continue collecting tariffs, for now.  “What I’ve really tried to work with the team on is to not actually overreact to any given moment,”  Best Buy  Chief Executive  Corie Barry  said Thursday.  For months, businesses across the U.S. that rely on imported goods have been trying to figure out how to navigate the on-again, off-again tariffs imposed by Trump.

headline: BBY Q1 Earnings Call: Revenue Misses Expectations, Management Highlights Tariff Headwinds and Marketplace Launch
summary: Electronics retailer Best Buy (NYSE:BBY) fell short of the market’s revenue expectations in Q1 CY2025, with sales flat year on year at $8.77 billion. Its non-GAAP EPS of $1.15 per share was 5% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

raw.headline: BBY Q1 Earnings Call: Revenue Misses Expectations, Management Highlights Tariff Headwinds and Marketplace Launch
raw.summary: Electronics retailer Best Buy (NYSE:BBY) fell short of the market’s revenue expectations in Q1 CY2025, with sales flat year on year at $8.77 billion. Its non-GAAP EPS of $1.15 per share was 5% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Best Buy Stock Is Falling After Earnings. Tariffs Weigh on Guidance.
summary: Shares of  Best Buy  slumped on Thursday after the electronics retailer trimmed its fiscal-year guidance to account for the effect of tariffs.  Domestic and international comparable sales each ticked down 0.7% in the quarter, and total revenue of $8.77 billion narrowly missed the $8.81 billion Wall Street had anticipated.  Chief Financial Officer Matt Bilunas said the company was adjusting its fiscal-year guidance to include the impact of tariffs.

Domestic and international comparable sales each ticked down 0.7% in the quarter, and total revenue of $8.77 billion narrowly missed the $8.81 billion Wall Street had anticipated.  Chief Financial Officer Matt Bilunas said the company was adjusting its fiscal-year guidance to include the impact of tariffs.

headline: Best Buy Has Already Passed on Tariff-Related Price Rises, Says CEO
summary: At electronics retailer Best Buy, Wednesday’s surprise trade court ruling doesn’t change much for now, said Chief Executive Corie Barry.  Best Buy also has worked to offset the impact by negotiating with its suppliers to reduce costs, adjusting the products it sells and expanding the number of countries from which it imports goods, said Barry.  In the few weeks since Best Buy’s price increases, demand for those items hasn’t fallen, she said.

raw.headline: Best Buy Has Already Passed on Tariff-Related Price Rises, Says CEO
raw.summary: At electronics retailer Best Buy, Wednesday’s surprise trade court ruling doesn’t change much for now, said Chief Executive Corie Barry.  Best Buy also has worked to offset the impact by negotiating with its suppliers to reduce costs, adjusting the products it sells and expanding the number of countries from which it imports goods, said Barry.  In the few weeks since Best Buy’s price increases, demand for those items hasn’t fallen, she said.

headline: Best Buy cuts 2025 guidance over Trump tariffs. Stock drops.
summary: Electronics retailer Best Buy's (BBY) stock is under pressure Thursday morning after releasing mixed first quarter results, beating earnings estimates but missing on revenue and seeing wider-than-expected declines in same-store sales. Yahoo Finance senior retail reporter Brooke DiPalma goes into detail on the store's full-year forecasts as it anticipates "the "impact of tariffs" from the Trump administration. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief here.

headline: Best Buy Cuts Guidance as Tariffs Loom
summary: Best Buy  cut its sales and profit forecast for the year to account for the global trade war, dragging its shares down ahead of the opening bell.  The electronics retailer on Thursday said it now believes comparable sales could decline this year as a result of the new levies.  Best Buy has warned previously that its import-reliant vendors would likely pass higher costs onto the retailer, which in turn would have to raise prices to protect its already thin margins, putting pressure on demand.

headline: Best Buy Stock Falls After Earnings. Fiscal-Year Guidance Cut to Account for Tariffs.
summary: Shares of  Best Buy  tumbled in premarket trading Thursday after the electronics retailer trimmed its fiscal-year guidance to account for the effect of tariffs.  Domestic and international comparable sales each ticked down 0.7% in the quarter, and total revenue of $8.77 billion narrowly missed the $8.81 billion Wall Street had anticipated.  Chief Financial Officer Matt Bilunas said the company was adjusting its fiscal-year guidance to include the impact of tariffs.

Chief Financial Officer Matt Bilunas said the company was adjusting its fiscal-year guidance to include the impact of tariffs.

headline: Best Buy (NYSE:BBY) Posts Q1 Sales In Line With Estimates
summary: Electronics retailer Best Buy (NYSE:BBY) met Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q1 CY2025, but sales were flat year on year at $8.77 billion. The company’s outlook for the full year was close to analysts’ estimates with revenue guided to $41.5 billion at the midpoint. Its non-GAAP profit of $1.15 per share was 5% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

Its non-GAAP profit of $1.15 per share was 5% above analysts’ consensus estimates.
